record.description: Art class unloading a kiln, circa 1904. Art classes served as an effective bridge between various disciplines. While drawing from a live model dressed as a Viking, students learned lessons about the history of costumes and the science of weapons. Ceramics provided a demonstration of delicate scientific principle; the sense of discovery was never more profound that when students unloaded the kiln.
